page.title: 07STATION TOWN AND WINGATE
page.content: Hutton Henry Colliery was sunk in 1871 and produced coal by 1876, this was the beginning of Station Town. It joined onto the southern border of Wingate;there is no separation.The Station was at the edge of Wingate hence Station Town.It is a residential area, the west side of the main road having council houses, an old peoples' home,a garage and Millbank Chapel _the only Methodist church left in the area.On the east side of the road are private terraced houses.Behind these is a new deuelopment of council houses (replacing old terraced houses),an old person's complex and a community centre. There is also a Co_op and several small shops.Where Wingate and Station Town meet is Wingate Front Street shopping area. There are food shops,a post office,library and DHSS Offices,but also many empty shops.
